raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "25/5 mmHg", "confidence": 8, "reasoning": "A Swan-Ganz catheter measures right heart pressures. Normal right ventricular (RV) pressures are typically 25/0-5 mmHg (systolic/diastolic). The systolic pressure should match the pulmonary artery systolic pressure (normally 15-30 mmHg), while the diastolic pressure should be close to right atrial pressure (normally 0-5 mmHg). Option 0 (25/10 mmHg) has an elevated diastolic pressure. Option 2 (10/0 mmHg) has a systolic pressure that's too low. Option 3 (100/70 mmHg) represents left ventricular pressures. Option 1 (25/5 mmHg) represents normal RV pressures with systolic at 25 mmHg and diastolic at 5 mmHg, which are within normal limits."}
